Dear Group,

I'm getting the following error message when I run the
constan=
t-pressure reactor demo (reactor1.py) with a different
chemistry model:

**=
**********************************************
                   Cantera E=
rror!                  
************************************************


=
Procedure: setState_UV 
Error:     no convergence. dt =3D 6.21468e-005
u =
=3D 619461 v =3D 3.87888

I haven't made any other changes to the script, a=
nd ck2cti (w/
validation on) didn't give me any real warnings when I conver=
ted the
mechanism. I checked out ThermoPhase.cpp and saw that this function=

solves for temperature given internal energy and specific volume by
Newton=
 iteration.

I've noticed that the script works when I change the initial
t=
emperature from 1000K to say 1001K, and I'm wondering if Newton's
method is=
 having trouble converging b/c many NASA polynomials have
Tmid =3D 1000 K, =
so Cv isn't exactly smooth at this temperature. Also,
the default tolerance=
 for this function is set to 1E-8, which may be a
little too stringent. I w=
ould think that knowing the temperature to
1E-4 K is probably more than suf=
ficient for most cases. Any thoughts?

Thanks,

Paul
